August 2, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I have just returned from New Brunswick to
find on my desk your good letter of July 26. Thank
you very much for all these suggestions. A cable
just received from Doctor Hanson states “Present
there is no known case in country and we hope epi-
demic has passed away.”

Unless the infection should break out in
some new place further south, it would seem that
the situation is in good shape. I quite appreciate
what you have to say concerning the importance of
Guayaquil and Peru. On the advice of Doctor White
we have contributed a small sum to Doctor Pareja to
help him to bring his mosquito index in Guayaquil
somewhat lower. The situation there seems to be
safe. We shall leave no stone unturned, however,
for its protection.

I have just reviewed recent reports from the
Doctor H R Carter
August 2, 1921
2.
entire yellow fever field. The situation is distinctly
encouraging: no new cases in Central America for more
than four months; no known cases in Yucatan; only a few
sporadic cases in eastern Mexico; the strong strategic
points seem to be held tight; we are weathering the
rainy season well.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor H R Carter
New Glasgow P O
Amherst County
Virginia
